messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C11N4 crystallizes in the tetragonal P-42m space group. There are five inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded to two equivalent C(4) and two equivalent N(1) atoms to form distorted CC2N2 tetrahedra that share corners with two equivalent C(2)C4 tetrahedra, corners with two equivalent C(3)C4 tetrahedra, corners with two equivalent C(5)N4 tetrahedra, and corners with four equivalent C(1)C2N2 tetrahedra. Both C(1)-C(4) bond lengths are 1.54 Å. Both C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.50 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded to four equivalent C(4) atoms to form CC4 tetrahedra that share corners with four equivalent C(3)C4 tetrahedra and corners with eight equivalent C(1)C2N2 tetrahedra. All C(2)-C(4) bond lengths are 1.56 Å. In the third C site, C(3) is bonded to four equivalent C(4) atoms to form CC4 tetrahedra that share corners with four equivalent C(2)C4 tetrahedra and corners with eight equivalent C(1)C2N2 tetrahedra. All C(3)-C(4) bond lengths are 1.52 Å. In the fourth C site, C(4) is bonded to one C(2), one C(3), and two equivalent C(1) atoms to form corner-sharing CC4 tetrahedra. In the fifth C site, C(5) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing CN4 tetrahedra. All C(5)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.47 Å. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to one C(5) and two equivalent C(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 2.434899999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.311358945833332 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C11N4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic P222 space group. There are six inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded to two equivalent C(4) and two equivalent N(1) atoms to form distorted corner-sharing CC2N2 tetrahedra. Both C(1)-C(4) bond lengths are 1.58 Å. Both C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.53 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing CN4 tetrahedra. All C(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.48 Å. In the third C site, C(3) is bonded in a distorted bent 120 degrees geometry to two equivalent C(4) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both C(3)-C(4) bond lengths are 1.55 Å. Both C(3)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.49 Å. In the fourth C site, C(4) is bonded to one C(1), one C(3), one C(5), and one C(6) atom to form a mixture of distorted corner and edge-sharing CC4 tetrahedra. The C(4)-C(5) bond length is 1.61 Å. The C(4)-C(6) bond length is 1.55 Å. In the fifth C site, C(5) is bonded in a 6-coordinate geometry to two equivalent C(6) and four equivalent C(4) atoms. Both C(5)-C(6) bond lengths are 1.79 Å. In the sixth C site, C(6) is bonded in a 6-coordinate geometry to two equivalent C(5) and four equivalent C(4) atoms. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to one C(1), one C(2), and one C(3) atom. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 1.2533440284999982 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C2N is Copper structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pa-3 space group. The structure is zero-dimensional and consists of four benzenehexacarbonitrile molecules. There are two inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to one C(2) and two equivalent C(1) atoms. The C(1)-C(2) bond length is 1.42 Å. Both C(1)-C(1) bond lengths are 1.41 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to one C(1) and one N(1) atom. The C(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.17 Å. N(1) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to one C(2) atom. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 3.118999999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.37433172624999905 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

N(CN)2 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Cmc2_1 space group. C(1) is bonded to one N(2) and three equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing CN4 tetrahedra. The C(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.45 Å. There are a spread of C(1)-N(1) bond distances ranging from 1.45-1.48 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent C(1) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a bent 120 degrees geometry to two equivalent C(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.5600306459999991 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C3N is alpha Rhenium trioxide structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. C(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.66 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent C(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NC6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 4.367345353124999 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C3N is Cyanogen Chloride-derived structured and crystallizes in the orthorhombic Cmmm space group. The structure is one-dimensional and consists of two acetylene molecules and two CN ribbons oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. In each CN ribbon, C(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.20 Å. N(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent C(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 2.097223170624999 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C3N crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mcm space group. The structure is one-dimensional and consists of one C3N ribbon oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. C(1) is bonded in a 4-coordinate geometry to two equivalent C(1) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both C(1)-C(1) bond lengths are 1.55 Å. Both C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.80 Å. N(1) is bonded in a distorted hexagonal planar geometry to six equivalent C(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 3.559278321874999 eV/atom.

C3N crystallizes in the tetragonal P4/mmm space group. There are three inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to one N(1) and one N(2) atom. The C(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.24 Å. The C(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.83 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to four equivalent C(3) and two equivalent N(2) atoms. All C(2)-C(3) bond lengths are 1.84 Å. Both C(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 1.69 Å. In the third C site, C(3) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to one C(3) and four equivalent C(2) atoms. The C(3)-C(3) bond length is 1.47 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent C(1) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent C(1) and four equivalent C(2) atoms to form corner-sharing NC6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 2.821813090624998 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C3N is Boron Nitride-like structured and crystallizes in the orthorhombic Cmcm space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two C sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction and two CN sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. In each C sheet, C(2) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent C(2) atoms. There are two shorter (1.40 Å) and one longer (1.41 Å) C(2)-C(2) bond length. In each CN sheet, C(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All C(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.40 Å. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent C(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.311132248125 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

C(1) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to one N(1) atom. The C(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.39 Å. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal planar geometry to three equivalent C(1) atoms. C3N crystallizes in the orthorhombic Cmmm space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two C3N sheets oriented in the (0, 1, 0) direction. There are two inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent C(2) atoms. Both C(1)-C(2) bond lengths are 1.31 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one C(1) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both C(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.59 Å. N(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four equivalent C(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

C3N is alpha bismuth trifluoride structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fm-3m space group. There are two inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent C(2) atoms. All C(1)-C(2) bond lengths are 2.07 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded in a distorted body-centered cubic geometry to four equivalent C(1) and four equivalent N(1) atoms. All C(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.07 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent C(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

C3N crystallizes in the orthorhombic Imma space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two C3N sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to two equivalent C(2) and one N(1) atom. Both C(1)-C(2) bond lengths are 1.45 Å. The C(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.33 Å. In the second C site, C(2) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to one C(1), one C(2), and one N(1) atom. The C(2)-C(2) bond length is 1.37 Å. The C(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.43 Å. N(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to one C(1) and two equivalent C(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

C3N crystallizes in the tetragonal P4/mmm space group. The structure consists of one 1,1-dimethylaziridinium molecule and one ammonia atom inside a C10N2N framework. In the C10N2N framework, there are six inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to one N(5) and one N(6) atom. The C(2)-N(5) bond length is 1.24 Å. The C(2)-N(6) bond length is 1.81 Å. In the second C site, C(3) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to four equivalent C(5), one N(1), and one N(6) atom. All C(3)-C(5) bond lengths are 1.69 Å. The C(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.56 Å. The C(3)-N(6) bond length is 2.15 Å. In the third C site, C(3) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to four equivalent C(5), one N(1), and one N(6) atom. All C(3)-C(5) bond lengths are 1.69 Å. The C(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.56 Å. The C(3)-N(6) bond length is 2.15 Å. In the fourth C site, C(4) is bonded in a linear geometry to one N(3) and one N(6) atom. The C(4)-N(3) bond length is 1.69 Å. The C(4)-N(6) bond length is 2.02 Å. In the fifth C site, C(4) is bonded in a linear geometry to one N(3) and one N(6) atom. The C(4)-N(3) bond length is 1.69 Å. The C(4)-N(6) bond length is 2.02 Å. In the sixth C site, C(5) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one C(5) and two C(3,3) atoms. The C(5)-C(5) bond length is 1.43 Å. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four C(3,3) atoms. In the second N site, N(3) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four C(4,4) atoms. In the third N site, N(5) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent C(2) atoms. In the fourth N site, N(6) is bonded in a distorted octahedral geometry to two equivalent C(2); two equivalent C(3); and two C(4,4) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 3.193112059374999 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

There is one shorter (1.46 Å) and one longer (1.49 Å) C(1)-C(2) bond length. In the second C site, C(3) is bonded in a distorted single-bond geometry to one C(1) and one N(1) atom. The C(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.22 Å. In the third C site, C(2) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to two equivalent C(1) and one N(1) atom. The C(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.33 Å. In the first C site, C(1) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one C(2), one C(3), and one N(1) atom. The C(1)-C(2) bond length is 1.39 Å. The C(1)-C(3) bond length is 1.39 Å. The C(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.45 Å. In the third C site, C(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one C(1), one C(3), and one N(1) atom. The C(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.44 Å. C3N crystallizes in the tetragonal P4/mmm space group. The structure is one-dimensional and consists of one ammonia atom; two tetramethylammonium molecules; one C12N cluster; and two CN ribbons oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. In the C12N cluster, there are two inequivalent C sites. In the first C site, C(3) is bonded in a single-bond geometry to four equivalent C(5) and one N(1) atom. All C(3)-C(5) bond lengths are 1.69 Å. The C(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.46 Å. In the second C site, C(5) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one C(5) and two equivalent C(3) atoms. The C(5)-C(5) bond length is 1.38 Å. N(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four equivalent C(3) atoms. In each CN ribbon, C(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent N(5,6) atoms. Both C(2)-N(5,6) bond lengths are 1.23 Å. N(5,6) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent C(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 2.636697703437499 eV/atom.
